revised_title: Quantum Cascade Lasers: A New Type of Resonant Tunnelling Light Sources
tldr: Researchers have developed a new type of semiconductor laser called quantum cascade lasers, which operate in the mid-infrared range. These lasers are based on resonant tunnelling and can be tailored to emit light over a wide range of wavelengths using the same heterostructure material. High-power room temperature operation has been achieved at wavelengths of 5 and 8.5 µm, making them suitable for applications like environmental sensing and pollution monitoring.
